Store

Class UnitFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • Store.UnitFactory

  • public class UnitFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    Creates different Units depending on arguments
    Since:
    1.2
    See Also:
    Item, Unit

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UnitFactory() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Unit createUnit(Item item)
      Creates WeighableUnit with 0 weight if item is weighable; If item is not weighable, creates RegularUnit with 0 amount of items.
      Unit createUnit(Item item, double weight)
      Creates WeighableUnit
      Unit createUnit(Item item, int amount)
      Creates RegularUnit

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • UnitFactory

        public UnitFactory()

    • Method Detail

      • createUnit

        public Unit createUnit(Item item)
        Creates WeighableUnit with 0 weight if item is weighable; If item is not weighable, creates RegularUnit with 0 amount of items.
        Parameters:
        item - Different constructors are called depending on items weighable attribute
        Returns:
        WeighableUnit or RegularUnit without amount/weight
        See Also:
        WeighableUnit, RegularUnit

      • createUnit

        public Unit createUnit(Item item,
                       int amount)
        Creates RegularUnit
        Parameters:
        item - Used for Unit creation
        amount - Sets amount of items in Unit
        Returns:
        RegularUnit with amount set
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If item is weighable or amount is negative
        See Also:
        RegularUnit

      • createUnit

        public Unit createUnit(Item item,
                       double weight)
        Creates WeighableUnit
        Parameters:
        item - Used for Unit creation
        weight - Sets weight of item in Unit
        Returns:
        WeighableUnit with weight set
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If item is NOT weighable or weight is negative
        See Also:
        WeighableUnit
